roleset.name: move like water
roleset.note: FLOW-V NOTES: Levin/Verbnet predicts an agentive reading, meaning "cause to flow",but we'll wait until we see an example. (from flow.01-v)
FLOW-N NOTES: Based on nouns-00080. VN class entity_specific_modes_being-47.2. Updated by Julia. (from flow.01-n)

example.name: flow-v: flow out of
example.text: Last week alone, an eye-popping $1.6 billion flowed out of the junk funds, or nearly 5% of their total assets, according to estimates by Dalbar Financial Services Inc., a Boston research firm.
example.arg: or nearly 5% of their total assets
according to estimates by Dalbar Financial Services Inc., a Boston research firm

example.name: flow-v: flow through
example.text: The 4.9 million-share volume flowing through the Jacobson specialist operation was about five times normal for the stock .

example.name: flow-n: use goal for destination/end point
example.text: the flow of foreign capital to the U.S.

example.name: flow-n: another nominal with an end point
example.text: The flow of water into the Shihmen Reservior

example.name: flow-n: with purpose
example.text: The flow of infomation into a manufacture's main computer network for use in business planning marketing and other operations
example.arg: into a manufacturer's main computer network
for use in business planning marketing and other operations

roleset.name: natural disaster: debris flow, pyroclastic flow
roleset.note: FLOW-N NOTES: Added by Julia in a Natural Disaster roleset endeavor. Comparison to mudflow, lahar. (from flow.02-n)

roles.note: The "VSP" function tags on 'death/injury toll' and 'damages/cost' correspond to the RED cause relation.

example.name: flow-n
example.text: I watched a Discovery Channel doc on Mt St Helens& the 300 mph pyroclastic flow.

example.name: flow-n
example.text: ... and the 60,000 tonne debris flow at Montrose in theDandenong Ranges of Victoria in 1891 (Moonand others 1992).
